title: Is It Time To Get Rid Of Noncompete Agreements?
teaser: The debate over noncompetes in Massachusetts pits many established corporations against Greater Boston’s tech sector.
contentencoded:
Massachusetts lawmakers are considering a ban on noncompete agreements. Those are the clauses in employment contracts that bar an employee from working for a competitor, sometimes for several years.

From the Here & Now Contributors Network, Curt Nickisch of WBUR reports that the debate pits many established Bay State corporations against Greater Boston’s tech sector.
